successDesc: This is a duck. The duck's tired, downcast beak is clearly right there.
failureDesc: The answer lacked confidence. The rabbit, which you believed to be a duck, fled.

successDesc: This is a rabbit. Its long ears doubtless indicate that it is a rabbit.
failureDesc: The answer lacked confidence. The duck, which you believed to be a rabbit, fled.

successDesc:
'Really?'

'What should we do? We'll be revolving together on a track that goes on for thousands of light years.'

'If you pity them...'

'And if I'm just revolving on someone else's track...'

'I suppose we're all pitiful things.'
failureDesc:
'Right.'

'It's so hard.'

The things bound to the tracks begin chirping affirmatively.

'Shut up!'

'You're the ones that bound yourselves to me!'

'No, you pulled me in!'

The bound things and the binding thing begin bickering.

There is no hope for a reconciliation.

successDesc:
'Right. I wanted to be lighter.'

'But look at this.'

'I'm still expanding because of these things that have bound themselves to me.'

'So... will you alleviate my weight a little?'
failureDesc:
'Wait... there's too much noise... so much chatter...'

'Everyone, shut up, stop binding yourselves to me'

The tracks around the entity grew and grew until its voice was heard no more.

successDesc: You find a skeleton amidst the pile of other bones. This may be the one trying to reach you. There's no telling if this is the right skeleton. Maybe you've prescribed meaning to something that just amounts to a pile of bones.
failureDesc: You tried your best to find the source of that sound, but it was to no avail. All flesh and hide are weathered away by the sands of time, and all that remains are indistinguishable bones. But the disembodied voice persists still.

successDesc:
Just a meaningless sound of wind whistling between the bones.

The sound of emptiness. The very same wind that will weave between our bones when we are buried here.
failureDesc: Nothing a quick ear swab can't fix. The noise died down like it was never even there.

successDesc:
A single breath was more than enough.

For the first time in their existence, they could breathe in and out as much air as they wanted without hurting.

Every living second of their life was pain. No one will ever understand that.
failureDesc:
Blowing air into its mouth was to no avail.

There was a coughing noise not long after.

Perhaps liberation is nigh.

successDesc:
Bandages, made to heal.

But he will bleed out as soon as these bandages are undone.

To maintain his shape... he must remain bound.
failureDesc:
The wounds bound by the bandages rot away little by little; nothing indicates that they are healing.

They serve only to hide the hideous wounds, not to heal them.

successDesc:
Chains, made to imprison.

He will endlessly struggle against the chains to be free.

To regain his authority. To speak the words unuttered, bound by the chains.
failureDesc:
It thrashed once, then ceased its movements evermore.

Perhaps it was because you defined the fabric as chains. Or, perhaps they really were bound by chains. No one will ever know.

successDesc:
To shake hands... is to share the solitude.

The hand was neither warm nor supple, but you held onto it for a long, long time.

Hoping that this little gesture have filled its hands, its loneliness, even a little.
failureDesc:
Its hands are already full of handshakes.

Your mere offer of a handshake is of no import to this being.

successDesc:
The true desire of its countless handshakes is a senseless one.

So even the hand that requests endless stream of handshakes must learn to sometimes let it flow past it.

Because we must all one day return with nothing in our palms.
failureDesc:
Something left scratch marks on your hand.

Wounds left by loneliness.

It was born out of an ephemeral moment, yet the wound will last awhile.

successDesc:
'Then please, light our path.'

'When the lamp's light fades, when there is nothing but utter darkness...'

'... we'll know we're at the right place.'

'There are lights that can be seen only when there is no other light.'

'There, you will see the color. The color of everything that was once abandoned, blended together.'
failureDesc:
'You still fear the dark, don't you?'

'I know that you will miss the surface, forever out of your reach once this fluorescent lamp dies'

'So do return once you're ready.'

successDesc:
'I remember. I've always wanted to run across a rolling field of grass under the warm sun.'

'To swim across the vast ocean that I've seen only through pictures.'

'That was my dream.'

'My only dream.'

'Now, if you ever recall a dream in which you wished to twinkle, even as a faint flicker...'
failureDesc:
The fluorescent light still flickers weakly.

'That's okay. Where we're going...'

'We don't need the light.'

successDesc:
'I see.'

'If my master is gone from the painting, the memories... what shall I do?'

'What if... one day... I start doubting that I ever had a master...'

Only the painting remains in the hallway now.
failureDesc:
'That cannot be.'

'Look not at the time that is spent, and focus on the painting.'

'The face of my master, who had to go through so much.'

You had to sit there and stare at the painting for a while.

successDesc:
'Is not the face of my master so graceful? The eyes, so deep. The gaze, so noble.'

'Thank you. I am starting to remember. The face of my master, reflected on your very own eyes.'
failureDesc:
'If you really can see my master's countenance... that's not the face you'd be making.'

'And those unimpressed, lifeless eyes aren't the look one would wear upon seeing my master's face.'

We were quickly deemed unwelcome, and were chased out of the mansion.

successDesc: You lower your head and pray. You hear the sound of trumpets. Yet you do not look up, and merely take in the sound. Because prayers are supposed to be like that.
failureDesc: Just because you're lowering your head and closing your eyes doesn't mean you're praying.

successDesc: Its translucent arms and head disappear. From the void flows dark red blood. Its slow, leaden flow is not unlike someone's flow of tears.
failureDesc: A large crack appears on the statue. It begins to tremble ominously. There is no choice but to accept what is to come.

successDesc:
Tell the truth.

You reply: the document says that the secret about the patient in room 409 must be kept.

'I knew it...!'

'But that patient... was...'

'AAAAAAGGGGHHHHH!'
failureDesc:
You try to tell the truth, but the figure does not believe you.

'Don't lie to me. The patient in room 409 is...!'

The figure is unable to hold back its emotions; it begins thrashing about, destroying everything around it.

successDesc:
'I knew it.'

'They lied to me...'

'Those pieces of shit lied to me!!!'
failureDesc: The figure crumbles up the paper and stomps off to somewhere.

successDesc:
You reach out with your hand and hold it in place before it swings back.

The bell dings faintly.

A dull and feeble noise.

Though it no longer bounces back with the same amount of force, it continues to sway back and forth.
failureDesc:
You firmly held it in place. Perhaps too firmly; it will never lose its balance again.

And it will never sway back and forth again.

The bell no longer tolls.

All that remains are gears and cogs.

successDesc:
You push it further, to the point where the bell's almost touching the ground.

But it does not fall.

Instead, it bounces back harder than it ever has, and it tolls loudly. Louder than any bell you've ever heard.
failureDesc:
You pushed the bell too far. It tips over, falling to the ground with a heavy thump.

It can no longer be made to stand again.

Its original role, once fallen, can never be recovered.
